Artificial Intelligence-based Vaccine Design: Utilize AI algorithms to predict the structure of the disease-causing virus, and design a vaccine accordingly. This approach would not only save time but also increase the accuracy of the vaccine's design.

DNA-based Vaccine Delivery: Develop a vaccine that utilizes DNA to deliver the disease-fighting genes to the body. This approach would ensure that the vaccine is more stable and can withstand extreme temperatures, making it ideal for remote areas.

Virus-like Particle (VLP) Vaccine: Create a vaccine that utilizes VLPs, which mimic the virus but cannot cause infection. These VLPs can stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies that can recognize and fight the disease.

Mucosal Adjuvated Vaccine: Develop a vaccine that targets the mucosal surfaces of the body, such as the nose and throat. This approach would ensure that the vaccine is more effective in protecting against respiratory diseases.

Self-amplifying RNA Vaccine: Create a vaccine that utilizes self-amplifying RNA (saRNA) technology, which can amplify the vaccine's effectiveness by producing multiple copies of the disease-fighting proteins. This approach would ensure that the vaccine provides long-lasting protection against the disease.
